result.execSummary:
The defendant Leo W. Burghagen Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Court has suggested Defendant's participation in criminal thinking class. Pay restitution, in the total of $803 to Sandy Schwingle, within the first eight months of probation. Pay costs and supervision fees.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leo W. Burghagen in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states the parties have a plea agreement. Def pleads no contest as charged. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty. DA addresses the Court and reads victim impact statement. Def addresses the Court. Sentence: 9 month jail with huber, imposed/stayed, for probation 1 year with conditions of $803 restitution, paid within first 8 months of probation; Court suggests criminal thinking group; def to pay costs of action.
Status conference on April 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Leo W. Burghagen in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states parties are working towards resolution; asks for reset.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.
